column4: i think there's a Jocket utility for text-mode 'jockey-text' probably
i've not used it, but it should be a friendly way to install the binary drivers
i think dpkg-reconfigure xserver-xorg will re-generate a clean xorg.conf file
how did you install the drivers?
I used the Hardware Drivers selection under System->Administration
i had good success with installing the drivers from nvidia, bit of a pain though
thanks to you too. I'm trying the rename of vesa to nv, and I am now restarting.
someone else suggested that, but good luck, it should work
are you using the proprietary drivers now?
I am using the nv which I assume is nvidia. Only thing is, when I go to the nvidia config tool It tells me I don't appear to be using the nvidia-x-driver
i think you're using the open source one
prince_jammys: installing the proprietary drivers is what got me here with no monitor recognition. now with the open source one my resolution is so huge a good portion of interface is off screen.
I am getting this when I use /etc/init.d/gdm restart: Rather than invoking init scripts through /etc/init.d, use the service(8)
they changed stuff recently, do what that says
I only used "restart gdm" and got: Warning: Fake initctl called, doing nothing.
i just went into a console, stopped gdm, wget'd the sode, compiled, and rebooted, iirc
